Items.name: Abandon
Items.definition: Cease to support or look after (someone); desert.

Items.name: Abuse
Items.definition: Use (something) to bad effect or for a bad purpose; misuse.

Items.name: Activity
Items.definition: The condition in which things are happening or being done.

Items.name: Adjourn
Items.definition: Break off (a meeting, legal case, or game) with the intention of resuming it later.

Items.name: Adversity
Items.definition: Difficulties; misfortune.

Items.name: Agree
Items.definition: Have the same opinion about something; concur.

Items.name: Ambush
Items.definition: Make a surprise attack on (someone) from a concealed position.

Items.name: Antagonize
Items.definition: Cause (someone) to become hostile.

Items.name: Arrive
Items.definition: Reach a place at the end of a journey or a stage in a journey.

Items.name: Assist
Items.definition: Help (someone), typically by doing a share of the work.

Items.name: Attach
Items.definition: Fasten; join.

Items.name: Attainment
Items.definition: The action or fact of achieving a goal toward which one has worked.

Items.name: Attract
Items.definition: Cause to come to a place or participate in a venture by offering something of interest, favorable conditions, or opportunities.

Items.name: Befriend
Items.definition: Act as a friend to (someone) by offering help or support.

Items.name: Bestow
Items.definition: Confer or present (an honor, right, or gift)

Items.name: Betray
Items.definition: Expose (one's country, a group, or a person) to danger by treacherously giving information to an enemy.

Items.name: Block
Items.definition: Make the movement or flow in (a passage, pipe, road, etc.) difficult or impossible.

Items.name: Break
Items.definition: Separate or cause to separate into pieces as a result of a blow, shock, or strain.

Items.name: Care
Items.definition: Feel concern or interest; attach importance to something.

Items.name: Carelessness
Items.definition: Failure to give sufficient attention to avoiding harm or errors; negligence.

Items.name: Carry
Items.definition: Support and move (someone or something) from one place to another.

Items.name: Celebrate
Items.definition: Acknowledge (a significant or happy day or event) with a social gathering or enjoyable activity.

Items.name: Change
Items.definition: Make or become different.

Items.name: Communicate
Items.definition: Share or exchange information, news, or ideas.

Items.name: Control
Items.definition: Determine the behavior or supervise the running of.

Items.name: Create
Items.definition: Bring (something) into existence.

Items.name: Cruelty
Items.definition: Callous indifference to or pleasure in causing pain and suffering.

Items.name: Debase
Items.definition: Reduce (something) in quality or value; degrade.

Items.name: Deceive
Items.definition: (of a person) cause (someone) to believe something that is not true, typically in order to gain some personal advantage.

Items.name: Decrease
Items.definition: Make or become smaller or fewer in size, amount, intensity, or degree.

Items.name: Delay
Items.definition: Make (someone or something) late or slow.

Items.name: Desert
Items.definition: Abandon (a person, cause, or organization) in a way considered disloyal or treacherous.

Items.name: Develop
Items.definition: Grow or cause to grow and become more mature, advanced, or elaborate.

Items.name: Dispute
Items.definition: Argue about (something); discuss heatedly.

Items.name: Disrupt
Items.definition: Interrupt (an event, activity, or process) by causing a disturbance or problem.

Items.name: Divide
Items.definition: Separate or be separated into parts.

Items.name: Dominate
Items.definition: Have a commanding influence on; exercise control over.

Items.name: Excitement
Items.definition: A feeling of great enthusiasm and eagerness.

Items.name: Expose
Items.definition: Make (something) visible by uncovering it.

Items.name: Extravagance
Items.definition: Lack of restraint in spending money or use of resources.

Items.name: Failure
Items.definition: Lack of success.

Items.name: Fight
Items.definition: Take part in a violent struggle involving the exchange of physical blows or the use of weapons.

Items.name: Gratify
Items.definition: Give (someone) pleasure or satisfaction.

Items.name: Guide
Items.definition: Show or indicate the way to (someone)

Items.name: Haggle
Items.definition: Dispute or bargain persistently, especially over the cost of something.

Items.name: Harm
Items.definition: Physically injure.

Items.name: Heal
Items.definition: (of a person or treatment) cause (a wound, injury, or person) to become sound or healthy again.

Items.name: Imitate
Items.definition: Take or follow as a model.

Items.name: Imprison
Items.definition: Put or keep in prison or a place like a prison.

Items.name: Increase
Items.definition: Become or make greater in size, amount, intensity, or degree.

Items.name: Inform
Items.definition: Give (someone) facts or information; tell.

Items.name: Inquire
Items.definition: Ask for information from someone.

Items.name: Inspect
Items.definition: Look at (someone or something) closely, typically to assess their condition or to discover any shortcomings.

Items.name: Intolerance
Items.definition: Unwillingness to accept views, beliefs, or behavior that differ from one's own.

Items.name: Judge
Items.definition: Form an opinion or conclusion about.

Items.name: Kill
Items.definition: Cause the death of (a person, animal, or other living thing)

Items.name: Lie
Items.definition: Tell a lie or lies.

Items.name: Malice
Items.definition: The intention or desire to do evil; ill will.

Items.name: Mistrust
Items.definition: Be suspicious of; have no confidence in.

Items.name: Move
Items.definition: Go in a specified direction or manner; change position.

Items.name: Neglect
Items.definition: Fail to care for properly.

Items.name: Negligence
Items.definition: Failure to take proper care in doing something.

Items.name: Open
Items.definition: Move or adjust (a door or window) so as to leave a space allowing access and view.

Items.name: Oppose
Items.definition: Disapprove of and attempt to prevent, especially by argument.

Items.name: Oppress
Items.definition: Keep (someone) in subservience and hardship, especially by the unjust exercise of authority.

Items.name: Overindulge
Items.definition: Have too much of something enjoyable, especially food or drink.

Items.name: Overthrow
Items.definition: Remove forcibly from power.

Items.name: Passion
Items.definition: Strong and barely controllable emotion.

Items.name: Persecute
Items.definition: Subject (someone) to hostility and ill-treatment, especially because of their race or political or religious beliefs.

Items.name: Postpone
Items.definition: Cause or arrange for (something) to take place at a time later than that first scheduled.

Items.name: Praise
Items.definition: Express warm approval or admiration of.

Items.name: Proceedings
Items.definition: An event or a series of activities involving a formal or set procedure.

Items.name: Procrastinate
Items.definition: Delay or postpone action; put off doing something.

Items.name: Propose
Items.definition: Put forward (an idea or plan) for consideration or discussion by others.

Items.name: Punish
Items.definition: Inflict a penalty or sanction on (someone) as retribution for an offense, especially a transgression of a legal or moral code.

Items.name: Pursue
Items.definition: Follow (someone or something) in order to catch or attack them.

Items.name: Recruit
Items.definition: Enlist (someone) in the armed forces.

Items.name: Refuse
Items.definition: Indicate or show that one is not willing to do something.

Items.name: Release
Items.definition: Allow or enable to escape from confinement; set free.

Items.name: Return
Items.definition: Come or go back to a place or person.

Items.name: Ruin
Items.definition: Reduce (a building or place) to a state of decay, collapse, or disintegration.

Items.name: Separate
Items.definition: Cause to move or be apart.

Items.name: Spy
Items.definition: Work for a government or other organization by secretly collecting information about enemies or competitors.

Items.name: Starting
Items.definition: Begin or be reckoned from a particular point in time or space; come into being.

Items.name: Stop
Items.definition: (of an event, action, or process) come to an end; cease to happen.

Items.name: Struggle
Items.definition: Make forceful or violent efforts to get free of restraint or constriction.

Items.name: Take
Items.definition: Lay hold of (something) with one's hands; reach for and hold.

Items.name: Transform
Items.definition: Make a thorough or dramatic change in the form, appearance, or character of.

Items.name: Travel
Items.definition: Go from one place to another, typically over a distance of some length.

Items.name: Trick
Items.definition: Deceive or outwit (someone) by being cunning or skillful.

Items.name: Triumph
Items.definition: Achieve a victory; be successful.

Items.name: Truce
Items.definition: An agreement between enemies or opponents to stop fighting or arguing for a certain time.

Items.name: Trust
Items.definition: Believe in the reliability, truth, ability, or strength of.

Items.name: Usurp
Items.definition: Take (a position of power or importance) illegally or by force.

Items.name: Vengeance
Items.definition: Punishment inflicted or retribution exacted for an injury or wrong.

Items.name: Violate
Items.definition: Break or fail to comply with (a rule or formal agreement)

Items.name: Waste
Items.definition: Use or expend carelessly, extravagantly, or to no purpose.

Items.name: Work hard
Items.definition: A great deal of effort or endurance.
